replication_study.hypothesis: Among illness episodes tested via CHW (maltest_where == 1) in post-baseline waves (wave != 0), assignment to any ACT voucher subsidy (act_subsidy = 1) increases the probability that the episode results in ACT take-up (took_ACT = 1), controlling for strata fixed effects (C(cu_code)) and covariates (refrigerator, mobile, vip_toilet, composting_toilet, other_toilet, stone_wall, cement_wall, num_sheep), with survey weights (weight).

data_plan.source_type: Original authors’ replication dataset (linked administrative and household survey records)
data_plan.sample_size: Total N in file: 7416 rows; analysis sample is restricted at runtime to maltest_where == 1 and wave != 0 (final N will be reported in the output).
data_plan.access_details: Provided in this repository; the analysis script assumes the file is placed at /app/data/ReplicationData_Cohen_AmEcoRev_2015_2lb5.dta.

qualification.explanation: This dataset allows a computational reproduction of the focal estimate using the same variables and coding as the original analysis. It is not an independent-sample replication, but it verifies reproducibility of the focal claim under the original data.
qualification.similarity_to_original: The provided .dta file is the authors’ replication dataset and contains the exact variables referenced in the original analysis, e.g., drugs_taken_AL (outcome), maltest_chw_voucher_given (treatment assignment), weight (sampling weight), cu_code (strata), and covariates such as ses_hh_items, ses_toilet_type, ses_wall_material, and ses_no_sheep. See: replication_data/ReplicationData_Cohen_AmEcoRev_2015_2lb5.dta (columns confirmed via get_dataset_columns) and the Stata .do file replication_data/Cohen et al 2015 - Replication Analysis.do.
qualification.deviation_from_original: This is the same dataset as used for the original replication files, so it is not a different sample. According to post_registration.json, the original design is an RCT in rural Western Kenya (2009). Our analysis reproduces the focal regression rather than testing on a new dataset. See post_registration.json and the do-file for variable construction and model specification.

data_plan.notes: Key transformations mirror the .do script: took_ACT from drugs_taken_AL; act_subsidy = 1 if maltest_chw_voucher_given==1 and missing if ==98; assets indicators parsed from ses_hh_items string; toilet and wall dummies from ses_toilet_type and ses_wall_material. Potential issues: the .do script references ses_hh_item (singular) in replace commands, which appears to be a typo; the available column is ses_hh_items (plural). The Python script handles missing ses_hh_items by setting the derived dummies to NaN when the source is missing.

planned_method.steps: 1) Load /app/data/ReplicationData_Cohen_AmEcoRev_2015_2lb5.dta. 2) Create variables: took_ACT from drugs_taken_AL; act_subsidy = 1{maltest_chw_voucher_given==1}, NaN if ==98; refrigerator/mobile indicators from ses_hh_items string; vip_toilet/composting_toilet/other_toilet from ses_toilet_type; stone_wall/cement_wall from ses_wall_material; num_sheep from ses_no_sheep; C(cu_code) for strata FE. 3) Restrict sample to maltest_where==1 and wave!=0. 4) Fit a weighted linear probability model: took_ACT ~ act_subsidy + C(cu_code) + refrigerator + mobile + vip_toilet + composting_toilet + other_toilet + stone_wall + cement_wall + num_sheep, using statsmodels WLS with weight=weight and robust (HC1) covariance. 5) Save coefficient table and text summary to /app/data. 6) Report the act_subsidy coefficient and robust SE.
planned_method.models: Weighted linear probability model (statsmodels WLS) with strata fixed effects and HC1 robust SEs. This approximates the Stata svy regression with pweights and strata FE.
planned_method.outcome_variable: took_ACT (constructed from drugs_taken_AL; 1 if ACT taken, else 0)
planned_method.independent_variables: act_subsidy (1 if any ACT voucher subsidy; NaN if maltest_chw_voucher_given==98)
planned_method.control_variables: C(cu_code) (strata fixed effects); refrigerator; mobile; vip_toilet; composting_toilet; other_toilet; stone_wall; cement_wall; num_sheep

planned_estimation_and_test.estimation: Coefficient on act_subsidy in the weighted LPM
planned_estimation_and_test.test: Two-sided t-test with HC1 robust SE; report coefficient, SE, t, p-value

planned_method.missing_data_handling: Listwise deletion for variables included in the model (drop rows with NaN in outcome, treatment, controls, weights, or FE).
planned_method.multiple_testing_policy: Not applicable to the single focal estimate; no correction applied.
planned_method.inference_criteria: Primary evidence is a positive coefficient on act_subsidy. For significance, alpha=0.05 two-sided using robust SE. We also compare magnitude to the reported 0.187 with robust SE ~0.038 and p<0.01.

files.Cohen_et_al_2015_Replication_Analysis__p: Python translation of the Stata do-file. Reads /app/data/ReplicationData_Cohen_AmEcoRev_2015_2lb5.dta; constructs variables; restricts to maltest_where==1 & wave!=0; runs weighted LPM with HC1 robust SEs and strata FE; saves CSV of coefficients and a text summary to /app/data.

codebase.notes: All file IO is restricted to /app/data for data inputs/outputs. The script expects the .dta file to be present at that path. Dependencies: pandas, numpy, statsmodels, pyreadstat.

analysis.instructions: 1) Place ReplicationData_Cohen_AmEcoRev_2015_2lb5.dta under /app/data. 2) Run: python Cohen_et_al_2015_Replication_Analysis__py.py. 3) Outputs will be saved to /app/data: cohen2015_replication_results.csv (coefficients, SEs, p-values) and cohen2015_replication_summary.txt (full model summary). 4) The focal comparison is the coefficient on act_subsidy; compare magnitude and SE with the original reported 0.187 (SE≈0.038).
analysis.comparison_metrics: Coefficient magnitude on act_subsidy; robust SE; t-stat; p-value; sign of effect; optionally R-squared and number of observations.
